publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2552 Brian Adam: House Building in the Bridge of Don Area—That the Parliament condemns the undemocratic procedures adopted by Aberdeen City Council Labour group in proposing an additional 700 or more houses in the Bridge of Don area despite a lack of adequate roads and other infrastructure; welcomes the group’s incompetence in failing to persuade all its colleagues to vote for the proposal, and calls on the Scottish Labour Party to investigate the practices of its councillors in Aberdeen.
S1M-2552 House Building in the Bridge of Don Area (lodged on 17 December 2001) Michael Matheson*

S1M-2552 Brian Adam: House Building in the Bridge of Don Area-That the Parliament condemns the undemocratic procedures adopted by Aberdeen City Council Labour group in proposing an additional 700 or more houses in the Bridge of Don area despite a lack of adequate roads and other infrastructure; welcomes the Group's incompetence in failing to persuade all its colleagues to vote for the proposal, and calls on the Scottish Labour Party to investigate the practices of its councillors in Aberdeen. Supported by: Michael Matheson
S1M-2552 House Building in the Bridge of Don Area (lodged on 17 December 2001) Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-2552 House Building in the Bridge of Don Area (lodged on 17 December 2001) Shona Robison*
S1M-2552 House Building in the Bridge of Don Area (lodged on 17 December 2001) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-2552 House Building in the Bridge of Don Area (lodged on 17 December 2001) Ms Sandra White*
